comments:
3.0 RC1

Occured suddenly when invoking code assist after "syn" to build a synchronized 
block. First the content assist opens showing all found proposals. The first 
is the synchronized template. Than before I can continue an empty dialog pops 
up with the title "Template Evaluation Error". Actually there are to 
exceptions logged, one immediately when the empty dialog pops up and one when 
I click "Ok" in the dialog.

First exceptions:

Created an attachment (id=11776)
source file showing the problem

- new workspace
- go to Window -> Preferences -> Java -> Editor -> Code Assist
- check "Fill argument names..."
- select "Completion overwrites"
- go to preference page Java -> Editor 
- select "Folding" tab
- ensure "Enable folding..." is checked
- check "Methods"; ensure "Inner types" & "Imports" is checked
- leave preferences dialog with "OK"
- disable auto build (uncheck Project -> Build Automatically)
- go to File -> New -> Project
- create PDE plug-in project (name "test", use defaults, switch to PDE
perspective)
- right click the source folder ("src") and select "New -> Package"
- create package "org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs"
- create new Java class (name "Job") inside package
"org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs"
- paste content of attachtment into new class
- save and close editor
- open file
- scroll down to error
- expand method "initializeWorker"
- position cursor behind "syn" (the error)
- invoke content assist
=> OK

- close editor
- import code formatter settings (see next attachement)
- open editor
- go to "syn"
- invoke content assist
=> ERROR

Created an attachment (id=11777)
code formatter settings to reproduce the problem

The NPE in AdditionalInfoController#computeInformation might be a seperate 
problem.

- formatting can fail

- we should not show a dialog if formatting fails
  - certainly not for the additional info
  - probably neither when inserting the template - just insert it unformatted

- NPE may be a consequence of showing the dialog - should recheck fProposalTable
in AdditionalInfoController.

3.0 candidate?
*** Bug 115809 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Simple steps:
1. in the 'try' template add a space between ${line_selection} and ${cursor} 
2. disable template formatting
3. in the  editor go into a method
4. type 'tr' + Ctrl+Space
